history.title: Founder
history.description: Coffee & Fun build software that’s functional, fun, and accessible, making a real difference in the digital world.

history.title: Founder
history.description: Solo Founded Helperbird as a side project into a thriving app for Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari, Google Docs & Google Slides. Helping 1,000,000 people to make the web more accessibile for everyone.

history.title: Owner and Author
history.description: Led various consulting projects for large-scale developers, specializing in JavaScript, Node.js, Golang, PHP, and other front-end and back-end technologies. Provided innovative solutions to complex problems and delivered high-quality results.

history.title: Team Lead and Software Engineer
history.description: Led a team of six developers in re-architecting the frontend and backend of Teamwork.com’s websites. Developed in-depth analytic tools to personalize the site for new and existing users. Utilized technologies such as Gulp, Webpack, CoffeeScript, Require.js, Pug, Travis, Jest, Node.js, NPM, SASS, Babel, Kubernetes, Golang, and ColdFusion, deploying to millions of users via AWS.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Developed a suite of importers for Teamwork.com Projects. Enhanced the sign-up process by adding Google sign-up and login support, and implemented new features and UX changes. Utilized Knockout.js, Require.js, CoffeeScript, ColdFusion, Golang, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and AWS for agile, test-driven development.

history.title: Software Engineer (Part-time)
history.description: Continued development work on Teamwork.com Projects while studying for a Computer Science degree. Enhanced the sign-up process, developed new features, and improved UX. Worked with ColdFusion, Golang, CoffeeScript, JavaScript, graphic design, and SEO.

history.title: Web Engineer (Internship)
history.description: Developed new features and pages for Teamwork.com and its CMS. Improved the sign-up process, added Google sign-up support, and implemented UX changes. Created server-side solutions using ColdFusion and Golang, and contributed to front-end development and graphic design.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Designed custom encryption algorithms for password resets in the enterprise market. Maintained and developed new features, and reviewed code for quality assurance.

history.title: Software Engineer
history.description: Designed and developed a social website for Autism Start, providing access to original content, a social network community, and tools for users. Enabled interaction through status updates, photo uploads, and public discussion forums.

history.title: Software Developer (Internship)
history.description: Designed and developed an interactive internal website for EMC employees. Enabled account creation, employee search, and mentor requests. Built with PHP, HTML5, CSS, and Microsoft Database.

history.title: Software Developer (Internship)
history.description: Gained experience in setting up networks and servers. Collaborated with departments such as Networking, Coding, Engineering, and HR. Redesigned the Visitors Portal Website to enhance information and interactivity through social sharing and videos.

history.title: Web Developer (Internship)
history.description: Participated in the National Young Scientist competition, leading to an invitation to the Microsoft Internship Workshop. Focused on developing critical links in the innovation process and commercializing skills such as software development and career development.

history.title: Web Developer (Internship)
history.description: Built circuit boards and coded pre-market test projects, writing C++ code for chips. Gained valuable experience in R&D, contributing to innovative solutions.
